# Angus Shoal Wave Parameters

## Data

```{r, echo=TRUE}

dat <- wv_read_txt(path, file_name = "2022.09.29 - Angus Shoal - Waves.txt")

head(dat)
```

- H = wave height (m)
- T = wave period (s)
- Dp = direction (degrees)
- Depth = sensor depth (m)?
- CM = ?
- CD = ?
- 1/10, 1/3, max, and p subscripts = ?

## Figures


```{r}
#| fig-height: 10
#| fig-cap: Time series of each parameter in the wave data.

levels <- c(
  "Hs", "Tp", "Dp", 
  "H1/3", "T1/3", "CD",     
  "H1/10", "T1/10", "CM",
  "Hmax", "Tmax", "Depth"
)

dat_long <- dat %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = Hs:CD, names_to = "variable", values_to = "value"
  ) %>% 
  mutate(
    variable = ordered(variable, levels = levels)
  )

p <- ggplot(dat_long, aes(timestamp_utc, value)) +
  geom_point(col = "grey20") +
  facet_wrap(~variable, ncol = 3, scales = "free_y") +
  theme_facet_plotly

ggplotly(p)

```

### Wave Height

```{r}
#| fig-height: 6
#| fig-cap: Time series of wave height parameters (filtered out 0's).

h <- dat %>%
  select(timestamp_utc, Hs, `H1/10`, `H1/3`, Hmax) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = Hs:Hmax, names_to = "variable", values_to = "value"
  )

p <- h %>%
  filter(value != 0) %>%
  ggplot(aes(timestamp_utc, value, col = variable, group = variable)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) 

ggplotly(p)

```

### Filtered
```{r}
#| fig-height: 6
#| fig-cap: Time series of frequency (filtered out negative frequencies).

per <- dat %>%
  select(timestamp_utc, Tp, `T1/10`, `T1/3`, Tmax) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = Tp:Tmax, names_to = "variable", values_to = "value"
  )

p <- per %>%
  filter(value > 0) %>%
  ggplot(aes(timestamp_utc, value, col = variable, group = variable)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) 

ggplotly(p)
```
